author: TravisEz13
body:
From:  https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/maintainers/releasing.md

- [x] Create a branch named `6.0.2` in private repository.
   All release related changes should happen in this branch.
- [x] Run tests on all supported Linux distros and publish results
- [x] Prepare packages
   - [x]  Build release packages
   - [x]  Sign the MSI packages and RPM package.
   - [x]  Install and verify the packages.
- [x]  Update documentation, scripts and Dockerfiles
   - [x]  Update [CHANGELOG.md](../../CHANGELOG.md) with the finalized change log draft.
   - [x]  Update other documents and scripts to use the new package names and links.
- [x]  Verify the release Dockerfiles.
- [x]  Create NuGet packages and publish them to `powershell-core` feed.
- [x]  Publish Linux packages to Microsoft YUM/APT repositories.
- [x]  Create the release tag and push the tag to `PowerShell/PowerShell` repository.
- [x]  Create the draft and publish the release in Github.
- ~~Merge the `release` branch to `master` and delete the `release` branch.~~
- [x]  Trigger the release docker builds for Linux and Windows container images.
   - [x]  Linux: push a branch named `docker` to `powershell/powershell` repository to trigger the build at [powershell docker hub](https://hub.docker.com/r/microsoft/powershell/builds/).
     Delete the `docker` branch once the builds succeed.
   - [x]  Windows: queue a new build in `PowerShell Windows Docker Build` on VSTS.
- [x]  Verify the generated docker container images.

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: Why is the branch in a private repo? This not very transparent/open source.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @bergmeister Please see our policy on [reporting potential security issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/maintainers/issue-management.md#security-vulnerabilities) and our [Release Steps](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/maintainers/releasing.md#release-steps).  At step 8 in the release, all work in the release will become public.  Other than work that must remain private due to policy, all work is also submitted to master and marked for the 6.0.2 milestone.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Nanoserver image is in docker hub and verified

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: @TravisEz13  Note that the [releases](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases) page contains a spelling mistake of the word `releases`: It says `v6.0.2 releaes of PowerShell Core`

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @bergmeister Thanks.  I think I fixed it.

title: PowerShell 6.0.2 Release
